spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The drow's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 18}). She can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The drow is a 12th-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 18}, {@hit 10} to hit with spell attacks). She has the following cleric spells prepared:

trait.name: Discern Lie
entries: The drow knows when she hears a creature speak a lie in a language she knows.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: The drow has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put the drow to sleep.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The drow has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the drow has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The drow makes three death lance attacks.

action.name: Death Lance
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) piercing damage plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) necrotic damage. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage it takes. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0.

variant.name: Demon Summoning
entries: Some drow inquisitors have an action that allows them to summon a demon.

entries.name: Summon Demon (1/Day)
entries: The drow attempts to magically summon a yochlol, with a {@chance 50|50 percent} chance of success. If the attempt fails, the drow takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) psychic damage. Otherwise, the summoned demon appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of its summoner, acts as an ally of its summoner, and can't summon other demons. It remains for 10 minutes, until it or its summoner dies, or until its summoner dismisses it as an action. (see notes for link)
